meanings.definition: To be in or assume a position in which the body is supported by the knees.
meanings.sent1: She was kneeling on the soft grass.
meanings.sent2: The knight was kneeling before the king.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was caught kneeling in front of the treat jar.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed to be kneeling under the weight of the rain.
meanings.sent5: The image of the monk kneeling in prayer was etched in her memory.

meanings.sent1: He was kneeling to tie his shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: The worker was kneeling to reach the lower shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat was caught kneeling on the cushion, looking guilty.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to be kneeling under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: The child was kneeling in excitement to pet the puppy.
